string-array.name: changelog_1.21.0
string-array.item: Remove Exchangerate.host, as the API was sold and is now commercial.
Instead, there\'s a bunch of new data providers. We will focus more on official providers (aka Central Banks) and try to add even more in the future.
New: Canadian central bank: Bank of Canada
New: Norwegian central bank: Norges Bank
New: Russian central bank: Bank Rossii
Now, there\'s a link in the settings which brings you straight to the source code repo.
Overall improvements, like improved error handling and updated translations.

string-array.name: changelog_1.7.0
string-array.item: Enjoy some big new feature in this release! Most notably, this app now includes historic rates. Check out the chart for the past year, to see how the currencies have developed.

There\'s also an additional exchange rate provider: You can now choose fer.ee in the settings. A relatively new service, that behaves basically like frankfurter.app and is just one more choice for you.
As always, this release includes updated libraries, small improvements and all the stuff that makes it even better.

string-array.name: changelog_1.3.0
string-array.item: So many more currencies! Over 160 in total, now!! That\'s because Currencies switched to a different API. The old one (exchangeratesapi.io) changed to a subscription model without any prior warning. NOT GOOD! Our new provider will be exchangerate.host.
That also means, that the last couple of days, the exchange rates couldn\'t be refreshed. That\'s fixed now, of course.
Also, the refresh process itself got improved, so at least next time something like that happens, you\'ll get a notice.
Small UI improvements

string-array.name: changelog_1.2.0
string-array.item: 17 new currencies! That\'s now 50 in total. 🥳 Too many to name them all. However, a lot of popular vacation destinations in the middle east and the caribbean are now included: UAE, Qatar, Barbados, Bahamas, Cuba, …
To stay on top of all those new choices, a search is now available in the currency picker.
The picker now also shows a currency\'s full name, not only its code. An awesome addition, in combination with the search. Try it out!
